Towards European-wide genomic surveillance of #gonorrhoea?

ECDC, @TheCGPS, @sangerinstitute, @PHE_uk study demonstrates the public health benefits of whole genome sequencing to understand distribution of strains and resistance within a population. 

https://t.co/jjs1HnJZV7

#Ebola outbreak in #DRC - ECDC risk assessment:

The risk of introduction and spread within EU/EEA is currently considered to be extremely low. 

https://t.co/SB4WQIOcNd

#EbolaDRC #EbolaRDC #Ebolaoutbreak #DRCongo

Today we kick-off European Immunization Week 2018! Follow @ECDC_VPD for updates throughout the week. Find out more: https://t.co/w2MwB0WWyg 

#VaccinesWork #ImmunizeEurope https://t.co/GGl06Clzsj

ECDC communication expert Linda Elsert is at #fluconf18 today discussing #flu across Europe, including #vaccination uptake. Find out more about ECDC's seasonal #influenza activities here ➡️ https://t.co/y3LC1L2Bjk https://t.co/beXhMU2l0r

Latest data: #measles outbreaks still ongoing in 2018. https://t.co/HpQpUqjbWc

Help the #EU increase #vaccination coverage by taking part in the @EU_Health public consultation on strengthened cooperation against #vaccine-preventable diseases ➡️ https://t.co/r6jn8Tjg0u https://t.co/6xFZpxe8zG

#AntimicrobialResistance in zoonotic bacteria still high in humans, animals and food. New report by ECDC & @EFSA_EU highlights emerging concerns, such as the highly resistant strain ESBL-producing #Salmonella Kentucky

Read more: https://t.co/fcDpt7ar3x

#AMRaction

Question on expanded role of #pharmacists in #vaccination delivery programmes, @ECDC_EU  replies they see that pharmacists are highly trusted & accessible HCP's for population so worth exploring expanded roles, at this stage still many legal barriers @PGEU #MakeHealthGreatAgain

Have your say on how to increase #vaccination coverage in the #EU via this @EU_Health open public consultation on ‘strengthened cooperation against vaccine-preventable diseases' ➡️ https://t.co/r6jn8Tjg0u https://t.co/qMLitRLGSR

Congenital Zika virus infection as a silent pathology with loss of neurogenic output in the fetal brain https://t.co/97HdZI75EK
Local #outbreaks have a global impact.  @WHO conducts #RiskAssessment for infectious diseases https://t.co/aDodHSoJY4

To prevent #Salmonella infections, both in infants and caregivers, the  #babymilk formulas involved in this outbreak should not be used.  https://t.co/hWEaSUTILJ

#Salmonella Agona outbreak: infant formula recall to reduce risk to public health, according to @ECDC_EU/@EFSA_EU joint assessment. However, the detection of new cases cannot be excluded. https://t.co/hWEaSUTILJ

. @ECDC_EU monthly report shows 87% of #measles cases in Nov 16 – Oct 17 were in unvaccinated individuals.
#Vaccination coverage rates must increase in several EU/EEA countries to reach elimination goals (latest coverage data from 2015-2016 in map below)
https://t.co/NF9PmgXd9e https://t.co/6bSWKsrArD

It's #WorldAIDSDay

In Europe, 1 in 2 #HIV positive people are diagnosed late in the course of their infection. 

We have the tools and knowledge to change this. 

Let's use them.

https://t.co/ttjjqoG3vg 
#WAD2017 #HIVzero #WorldAIDSDay2017 https://t.co/UmxSLhnXwG

@EU_Health @V_Andriukaitis @EU_Commission @BritishHIVAssoc @ILGAEurope @WHO_Europe @WHOatEU @THTorguk @TheLancetHIV @Europarl_EN The proportion of those diagnosed late ⬆️ with age in the EU/EEA 

In 2016, two thirds (63%) of people aged 50+ received their #HIV diagnosis late

Europe needs to ensure that all ages are appropriately targeted by sexual health services

https://t.co/Ed2Di6fIxk
#WorldAIDSDay https://t.co/T8EErqfTrY
